page.title: 20Housing Survey
page.content: Most of the houses had been built since the Second World War. There are hardly any houses of the time before the First World War. Between the wars the western side of the village began to grow with many big houses having large gardens. Since the Second World War the owners of these houses have often sold half of the garden as building land for a bungalow. Other new houses have mostly been built to the east of Sandwich Road and along Archers Court Road. It was found that before there were pavements in Archers Court Road people used to cross a small bridge over a deep ditch to get to their houses.
